author: colemickens
body: After #2001, it would be good to publish continously integrated Docker containers of PowerShell to Docker Hub under an official account `docker.io/microsoft/powershell` or `docker.io/powershell/powershell` maybe.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: I know @pcgeek86 wanted to submit a PR on this, I'm sure we'd be willing to take it if it was done right :)

comments.author: pcgeek86
comments.body:
@joeyaiello Thank you for roping me in!

I sent you guys a Dockerfile via e-mail, however it has gone through some changes since then. Can we define some requirements around "done right?" I'd be happy to contribute automated builds.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Pending. Will be doing this probably tomorrow. @joeyaiello need to run some tag organization questions by you.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
FYI, while I'm waiting for #2263 to get settled, this works swell:

```
docker run -it andschwa/powershell
```

I've set the latest tag to be the Ubuntu 16.04 minimal/stable image (i.e. package installed; not built from master).

comments.body: This is done as far I as I have permissions to do so; assigning over to @SteveL-MSFT for final integration to the official Docker hub.
